[30;1m1163 | [0m[35m        # CPP23: std::unique_ptr in heap_object is constexpr.[0m
[30;1m1164 | [0m[35m        # Hence, the compiler will try to instantiate the destructor on definition.[0m
[30;1m1165 | [0m[35m        # If the destructor was defined inside heap_object, other classes would only[0m
[30;1m1166 | [0m[35m        # be forward declared at this point.[0m
[30;1m1167 | [0m[35m        # This results in an error, because the destructor cannot be generated for[0m
[30;1m1168 | [0m[35m        # incomplete types.[0m
[30;1m1169 | [0m[35m        # Therefore, the destructor is defined here, after all classes have been defined.[0m

[30;1m338 | [0m[35m    implementation must have some way of fetching the Directory listing at[0m
[30;1m339 | [0m[35m    runtime based on the `location` field.[0m
[30;1m340 | [0m[35m[0m
[30;1m341 | [0m[35m    If a Directory does not have `location`, it is a Directory literal.  A[0m
[30;1m342 | [0m[35m    Directory literal must provide `listing`.  Directory literals must be[0m
